purpleculture_pinyin:
liú
surname Liu
фамилия Лю
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 刘)
Pictophonetic: 卯 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
劉伯溫 [ liú bó wēn ]: Liu Bowen (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋 , with a reputation as a military genius; also called Liu Ji 刘基
劉備 [ liú bèi ]: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
劉光第 [ liú guāng dì ]: Liu Guangdi (1859-1898), one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898
劉公島 [ liú gōng dǎo ]: Liugong island in the Yellow sea
劉向 [ liú xiàng ]: Liu Xiang (77-6 BC), Han Dynasty scholar and author
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • ⿱ Above to below
      • 卯 [ mǎo ] 4th terrestrial branch; period from 5-7 a.m.
      • 金 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
heisig_chinese_memo: Because the police had confiscated the swords (though they got a receipt in return) from the group of men protecting the gold transport, bandits attacked them with sabers and slaughtered every last one of them. This was the story line of the latest crime drama starring Lucy Liu as the detective.
Ru_Meaning: weapon of war, logging axe, kill en masse, peeling (paint off a wall, etc), sparse, faded
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hare (卯) with the gold (金) uses his sword (刂) to kill en masse
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: General Liu's best buddy was a highlander from Scotland who gave him a saber for his birthday.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold ", from "丣", from " knife ", same as "镏", which means axe. "Shu‧Gu Ming": "One person holds Liu in the head and stands in the East Hall." Kong Chuan: "Liu, the genus of Yue." Kong Yingda quoted Zheng Xuan and said: "Liu, cover the present with axe."

" Liu " can mean killing. "Shuowen": "Kill also." Xu Kai's note: ""Shuowen" does not have the word Liu, but there are some in the side. This word is not seen in history, and it is suspected that this is the word Liu. From Jin Congya, the word "sword" is Ququ , The biography is mistaken as Tian Er." "Book‧Pangeng 1": "Respect my people, endless Liu." Kong Chuan: "Liu, kill also."

" Liu " also means to conquer and defeat. "Book of the Yi Zhou‧ World Prisoner Jie": "Xianli Liu, Shang Wang Jun, held the enemy of a hundred evil officials." Kong Chao's note: "Liu, Ke Ye.

" Liu " also means peeling and withering. "Poetry·Daya·Sang Rou": "Take the Liu, and then the people." Mao Chuan: "Liu, explodes and hopes." Zhu Xi's Collected Biography: "Liu, Can."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold ", from "丣", from " sword ", same as "镏", which means axe.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，從「丣」，從「刀」， 同「鎦」，表示斧鉞。《書‧顧命》：「一人冕執劉，立於東堂。」孔傳：「劉，鉞屬。」孔穎達疏引鄭玄曰：「劉，蓋今鑱斧。」

　　「劉」可表示誅殺。《說文》：「殺也。「徐鍇注：「《說文》無劉字，偏旁有之，此字又史傳所不見，疑此即劉字也。从金从丣，刀字屈曲，傳寫誤作田尔。」 《書‧盤庚上》：「重我民，無盡劉。」孔傳：「劉，殺也。」

　　「劉」也表示征服、戰勝。《逸周書‧世俘解》：「咸劉商王紂，執矢惡臣百人。」孔晁注：「劉，剋也。」

　　「劉」還表示剝落、凋殘。《詩‧大雅‧桑柔》：「捋采其劉，瘼此下民。」毛傳：「劉，爆爍而希也。」朱熹集傳：「劉，殘。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，從「丣」，從「刀」， 同「鎦」，表示斧鉞。

Liushutong characters (63)

劉字的基本解释

劉
liú
见“刘”。

劉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liú］
［《廣韻》力求切，平尤，來。］
亦作“刘1”。“刘3”的繁体字。
(1)兵器名。斧钺。
(2)诛杀。
(3)克，战胜。
(4)剥落；凋残。
(5)通“膢”。祭名。
(6)果树名。
(7)古地名。一在今河南偃师南。《左传·隐公十一年》：“王取鄔、劉、蔿、邗之田于鄭。”一在今山东曲阜附近。《左传·襄公十五年》：“二月己亥，及向戌盟于劉。”
(8)为水名。见《水经注·洛水》。
(9)姓。
[②]［liǔ］
［《集韻》力九切，上有，來。］
通“懰1”。亦作“刘2”。“刘4”的繁体字。
美好貌。《诗·陈风·月出》“佼人懰兮”，陆德明释文本作“劉兮”，谓“劉，本又作懰，同。力久反，好貌。《埤蒼》作嬼。嬼，妖也。”

劉字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　劉； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页144第39
〔古文〕鎦?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?力求切，音留。【說文】殺也。【書·盤庚】重我民，無盡劉。【詩·周頌】勝殷遏劉。【左傳·成十三年】䖍劉我邊陲。又【爾雅·釋詁】劉，?也。【疏】謂敷?也。又【爾雅·釋詁】劉，㬥樂也。【疏】木枝葉稀疎不均爲㬥樂。【詩·大雅】捋采其劉。【毛傳】劉，爆爍而希也。又【爾雅·釋木】劉，劉杙。【註】劉子生山中。【疏】劉一名劉杙，其子可食。又姓。【韻會】凡二十五望，?自陶唐氏劉累之後。又【集韻】力九切，留上聲。好也。又【集韻】龍珠切，音鏤。殺也。漢禮，立秋有貙劉。又【同文備考】作鐂。

劉字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
劉字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Liu
liú

Liu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［liú］
["Guangyun" strives to cut, Pingyou, come. ]
Also known as "Liu 1". Traditional characters for "刘3".
(1) The name of the weapon. Axe.
(2) Punishment.
(3) Grams, victory.
(4) Spalling; withered.
(5) Through "fat". Sacrifice name.
(6) The name of the fruit tree.
(7) Ancient place names. One is in the south of Yanshi, Henan today. "The Eleventh Year of Zuo Zhuan: Yin Gong": "Wang took Wu, Liu, Lin, Hanzhi Tian Yu Zheng." One is near Qufu, Shandong today. "Zuo Zhuan·Xianggong Fifteen Years": "February Jihai, and Xiangxu League Yu Liu."
(8) is the name of the water. See "Shui Jing Zhu · Luoshui".
(9) Last name.
[②] [liǔ]
["Jiyun" force nine cuts, there is on top, come. ]
Same as "懰1". Also known as "Liu 2". Traditional characters for "刘4".
Good looking. In "Poetry·Chen Feng·Yuexiu", Lu Deming interprets the text as "Liu Xi", saying that "Liu, the original is also called "Liu Xi". Huh, demon too."
